edu.biu.scapi.primitives.dlog.openSSL
Class OpenSSLDlogECF2m

java.lang.Object
  edu.biu.scapi.primitives.dlog.DlogGroupAbs
      edu.biu.scapi.primitives.dlog.DlogGroupEC
          edu.biu.scapi.primitives.dlog.openSSL.OpenSSLAdapterDlogEC
              edu.biu.scapi.primitives.dlog.openSSL.OpenSSLDlogECF2m
All Implemented Interfaces:
DlogECF2m, DlogEllipticCurve, DlogGroup, primeOrderSubGroup, CDH, DDH, Dlog, DlogSecLevel, SecurityLevel
public class OpenSSLDlogECF2m
extends OpenSSLAdapterDlogEC
implements DlogECF2m, DDH

This class implements an Elliptic curve Dlog group over F2m utilizing OpenSSL's implementation.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

generateElement

public GroupElement generateElement(boolean bCheckMembership,
                                    java.math.BigInteger... values)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Description copied from interface: DlogGroup
This function allows the generation of a group element by a protocol that holds a Dlog Group but does not know if it is a Zp Dlog Group or an Elliptic Curve Dlog Group. It receives the possible values of a group element and whether to check membership of the group element to the group or not. It may be not necessary to check membership if the source of values is a trusted source (it can be the group itself after some calculation). On the other hand, to work with a generated group element that is not really an element in the group is wrong. It is up to the caller of the function to decide if to check membership or not. If bCheckMembership is false always generate the element. Else, generate it only if the values are correct.

Specified by:
generateElement in interface DlogGroup
Returns:
the generated GroupElement
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

simultaneousMultipleExponentiations

public GroupElement simultaneousMultipleExponentiations(GroupElement[] groupElements,
                                                        java.math.BigInteger[] exponentiations)
Description copied from interface: DlogGroup
Computes the product of several exponentiations with distinct bases and distinct exponents. Instead of computing each part separately, an optimization is used to compute it simultaneously.

Specified by:
simultaneousMultipleExponentiations in interface DlogGroup
Returns:
the exponentiation result

encodeByteArrayToGroupElement

public GroupElement encodeByteArrayToGroupElement(byte[] binaryString)
Encode a byte array to an ECF2mPointBc. Some constraints on the byte array are necessary so that it maps into an element of this group. Currently we don't support this conversion. It will be implemented in the future. Meanwhile we return null.

Specified by:
encodeByteArrayToGroupElement in interface DlogGroup
Parameters:
binaryString - the byte array to convert
Returns:
the created group Element

decodeGroupElementToByteArray

public byte[] decodeGroupElementToByteArray(GroupElement groupElement)
Decode an ECF2mPointBc that was obtained through the encodeByteArrayToGroupElement function to the original byte array. Currently we don't support this conversion. It will be implemented in the future. Meanwhile we return null.

Specified by:
decodeGroupElementToByteArray in interface DlogGroup
Parameters:
groupElement - the element to convert
Returns:
the created byte array

mapAnyGroupElementToByteArray

public byte[] mapAnyGroupElementToByteArray(GroupElement groupElement)
This function maps a group element of this dlog group to a byte array.

This function does not have an inverse function, that is, it is not possible to re-construct the original group element from the resulting byte array.

Specified by:
mapAnyGroupElementToByteArray in interface DlogGroup
Parameters:
groupElement - the element to convert
Returns:
the byte array representation

exponentiateWithPreComputedValues

public GroupElement exponentiateWithPreComputedValues(GroupElement groupElement,
                                                      java.math.BigInteger exponent)
Description copied from interface: DlogGroup
Computes the product of several exponentiations of the same base and distinct exponents. An optimization is used to compute it more quickly by keeping in memory the result of h1, h2, h4,h8,... and using it in the calculation.

Note that if we want a one-time exponentiation of h it is preferable to use the basic exponentiation function since there is no point to keep anything in memory if we have no intention to use it.

Specified by:
exponentiateWithPreComputedValues in interface DlogGroup
Overrides:
exponentiateWithPreComputedValues in class DlogGroupAbs
Returns:
the exponentiation result
